review_list:
The location is great. The atmosphere of the restaurant and the service are excellent. And the food does not disappoint either.

The combination of wonderful service, beautiful decor, and extraordinary food make this a must see meal for a foodie in New Orleans. The lobster ravioli appetizer was delicate and perfectly made. A romantic, secluded ambience with high walls and booths around many tables. Booths were comfortable--better than most restaurant booths. Food and wines were also excellent in presentation and taste. I liked the "Scalibut." Waiter was busy but did not neglect us or rush us. Truly a teriffic dining experience. Not too noisy.

This is an excellent restaurant in the French Quarter. It is a nice atmosphere, not too noisy and the food is great. Came to this lovely restaurant at Mardi gras and yet they seem to glide gracefully through the service. Waitress was very attentive but discreet and left you to decide. This is the place to go if you want fresh fish. They only serve the freshest! Make sure you ask for the biscuits. They bring you homemake drop biscuits before your meal. The atmosphere is great. Great location! Highly recommended!

Very good meal. You must find this place. Well worth the find. Best steak-ever. Staff so nice. Hubby had lamb nice too.xx

New Orleans is a food city. The grapevine is a hideaway with an exceptional wine list and great food! I recommend the bbq shrimp, the French Bread is exceptional and the goat cheese salad a classic.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in the city, it is Cosy, has a great wine list, a lovely courtyard dining area, weather permitting, and has wonderful food. The BBQ shrimp are delicious, and the chocolate mousse is divine. Not stuffy, but not overly casual, it just has the right ambience.

We ducked in here to get away from the madness of the French Quarter. What a great move. After looking over their menu, we decided to stay for dinner. The atmosphere was intimate and quiet. The service was great and the food outstanding. Plus, they have a good wine selection. If you go, try the lamb. It was delicious.

The Grapevine is a quiet gem that we appreciate. Menu has a good selection of cocktails, appetizers that compliment the atmosphere and food to be proud of.

Got there early and had wine and cheese plus the complimentary bacon! Then we had dinner AND the white chocolate bread pudding for dessert. OMG. We've been here twice this trip so far. Not ruling out another stop!

If you are looking for a quiet escape from the crazy this is THE place to be! The food I delicious and the service cannot be beat!!!

Cute little place tucked in just a bit off of Bourbon Street on Orleans. Food is fresh and trendy. Wine selection and other spirits great. Earl, Pam and their staff are warm and welcoming. Shaya brings the hits with small and medium plates for the table ... all loaded with exquisite flavor. Choose from several different hummus dishes, then sample the poached cabbage and Moroccan carrots. And there are plenty of lamb dishes to choose from. The avocado with smoked perch is excellent.

New Orleans has a growing base of 'ethnic' food restaurants, but is still lacking in that area for a city our size. Shaya represents a move toward making New Orleans famous for more than just local food, which we can appreciate.

it is not the best but one of the best restaurants in New Orleans especially for dinner.Wine list is rich enough but wine prices are so high.

Great place for dining and wine. Started with a nice German Pinot Noir. Then had Gumbo, snapper with mushrooms, and an after dinner bourbon. The service was great. Life is good and God bless John Besh.

Excellent food and the right atmosphere give in the perfect combination for a dinner! I went there twice, the 2nd time with my friends in my vacation because I couldn't wait to show my friend this lovely place!

A great restaurant a very nice atmosphere.an excellent local food .the executive chef deserve an applause.a very professional service.their signature dishes definitely worth trying.

This was my second visit to August. Food is amazing. Location has so much southern charm. Great cocktail, fantastic service. Love the food. Lives up to my expectations every time. Don't miss it!

Amazing. One of the best sandwiches I've ever eaten, and everything on the menu looked wonderful. Cool atmosphere, laid-back, great service. An absolute gem. If you're near the museums, a perfect spot to grab lunch.

This amazing dining spot is walking distance from the Ogden and WW2 museums. Went here on local recommendation and we're so thankful. Amazing sandwiches and sides. Best King cake in the city. So many excellent choices to choose from. I started with Boudan, which was tremendous. Then had the porkbelly and mint sandwich. Also fantastic. Topped it off with a slice of Elvis King cake. Looking forward to coming back and trying more things.

The cafe looks and feels like it was pulled out of Paris and dropped in the Quarter. Sunny, lovely window seating and jaw-droppingly beautiful pastries. All three in our party ate a filling lunch of delicious croissant sandwiches for less than $20. They also serve French style King Cake!

I enjoy having breakfast or a snack here every time I'm in town. The pastries are beautiful and delicious. The staff are helpful, cheerful, and very polite. They have expanded their menu to include breakfast items as well

A nice place for a cappucino, but the ham and cheese croissant were a bit tough. Possibly due to microwave warming. A bit disappointing.

OMG there are some items here that are truly fabulous to name just a few...the croissants with beuchamel sauce (have them served warm), if you like brioche...the royale brioche, cafe Au lait, macaroons, croissants with apple and raspberry, etc. We happened upon Le Croissant d'Or and now we make it de-rigueur for breakfast in New Orleans.

this quaint place was off the beaten path in the French Quarter but close enough and worth finding. The croissants were melt-in-your-mouth fresh even after travelling on a plane with them. We had chocolate, almond and plain croissants and each was a perfect piece of Paris.

The best croissants anywhere. A beautifully maintained older shop. The subway tile walls, ceiling medallions, and ceramic hex tile floor add to the charm of this bright, airy bakery and coffee shop. We're going back tomorrow!

This was our first time visiting this location and our party of 5 was not disappointed to say the least. Great food. Everyone in our party had something different from Oysters to Shrimp with Linguini, to my entree Veal Marsala, which by the way was the best I have eaten. Awesome. Make your reservation now.

Birthday celebration with friends. Elegant decor and first class service. The appetizers were large and very splitable. Mussels are excellent and could be an entree paired with the wonderful bread. The restaurant has great ambiance. And the food is great. The portions are average but they are right portions. And they taste awesome.

We love this bar. We look forward to having a perfectly prepared hurricane and a Rum & Coke every time we visit, which is 2-3 times a year. Fun to get a drink and sit in chairs outside the bar and watch the crowds. Don't miss it when you visit New Orleans.

the Pimms cup is amazing and the hurricanes a little deadly. Great lighting and music and small yet cosy atmosphere. Music is not too loud or intrusive but lends to atmosphere. La fittes is at the quiet end of Bourbon Street

Had a great time here. Fun atmosphere and definitely different. Dont wear your sunglasses in here or it will be pitch black!

Stop by for a drink and an obligatory picture. Cool little place for pirates :) they also served us curb side on our carriage tour.

its a cool place and prices are fair for the area. one of the few places that doesn't water down their liquor in the French quarter.

My husband and I stepped out for a drink one night and had to check out this historic haunt of the Pirate La Fitte. In the back room, there is a piano manned by a team who will sing your requests for tips. Great crowd and good drinks.

Fresh, sweet and good!

Had a wonderful, quick breakfast here on first day in town. Right by Canal St. and our hotel. Breakfast was quick and delicious diner style fare. Good place for a not too expensive meal to start your day.

We came here for breakfast, the place is not bad, took a little bit for our overwhelmed waitress to get to our table, the food came out as ordered and was ok, nothing special. While it wasn't bad, i would try somewhere else next time.

Mena's is a casual spot in the French Quarter, featuring actual New Orleans locals! Had breakfast here rather than wait in line for the tourists spots down the street. Sat at the bar. Simple menu, quick friendly service, and excellent Bloody Mary's! I recommend the Cajin Omelette, but I don't know what's in it. Save time, enjoy Mena's!

I do think they do breakfast better. Once we waited in line breakfast was over and we had to get lunch. The homemade Italian dressing was excellent. But lunch food not so good. Serve was good.

This restaurant is primarily a breakfast place. The food is not very good and the service is surly. While we were there, we witnessed the staff refuse to let a man in a wheelchair enter. I assume because the restaurant was crowded, but that is no excuse.

Had a good breakfast here before the saints game. Looking forward to going back & enjoying lunch & the bar. Great atmosphere.

We had Meatball Sandwich, Muffaletta on French, and Shrimp Po-Boy. Well priced, fast service, and quaint environment. Definitely worth stopping in for a bite to eat!

We were forced out of our French Quarter routine because our usual breakfast spot was closed for renovations. We found this and fell in love. The grits were outstanding, as was the service. Several of our party liked the fact that they could order a la carte items for a smaller breakfast. My boyfriend and I split a tasso omelette...


More  



We eat at Mena's at least once or twice when in NOLA. We love the breakfast, the people, and the atmosphere. On our last visit our server was Maeghan. She was totally awesome!

Was looking for a down-home local restaurant and found it at Mena's. The breakfast was very good, our service was excellent and the prices were average. It's a popular place.....we were packed in there like sardines.
title: Mena's Palace, New Orleans

review_list:
A tiny hole in the wall we found on our last trip, where we sat and chatted with the owner. We returned this trip and enjoyed another great lunch and a good drink. Highly recommend Backspace.

Great atmosphere!! The drink special was incredible. My hubby and I drank Blue Moon's for $3 a pint. Can't find that on Bourbon St. The bartender was super friendly and answered all our questions. I would go back for sure.

The food was very good & unique, a very nice step away from the normal late night food that can be found all over the quarter. I don't know if it was a late night happy hour or if it was just the cheapest draft Abita I bought the whole trip?? Either way, it's a great little place!

Popped in here on a whim, and ended up spending most of my New Orleans nights around the bar. Tap beer is cheap and always cold, and the staff are very friendly and willing to chat. Would definitely visit again.

Big fan of this place. It is easy to hang out there, doesn't have the typical touristy vibe and is a bit out of the way of Bourbon St. insanity. Definitely stop by.

Backspace Bar & Kitchen is a hidden gem in the French Quarter. The food is amazing and delicious, Unfortunately the service is horrible. More  



This is a quaint but trendy food and bar near Bourbon Street in the heart of the French Quarter. The food and drinks are tasty, staff is nice, food is delivered in a timely fashion. The BLT and burgers were excellent. Definitely worth checking out if near the area.

This was a great little bar with good prices a good atmosphere and friendly bar staff. It also had sports showing on TV.

Hands done best burger I have ever had. Do not let the outside or even inside appearance fool you. Great drinks, awesome burgers and friendly service. Never crowded. Locals secret right in the French Qtr

In this den-like atmosphere comes a very nice burger surrounded by a fireplace, stuffed animals and comfy chairs. It's a given that all the dishes & drinks have literary names as you would expect. Nice, cooked to order sammich served with cheese, bacon, bacon and grilled onions.

This little corner restaurant has only a few tables but we got our Po-Boys to go. We ordered the grilled shrimp Po-Boys and they were delicious! The 6-inch sandwiches are big :) and filling! There was a bit of a wait for our sandwiches but it was worth the wait!

This is what po boys are supposed to be.
Let the tourists eat in the quarter.
Guy's is on point!
This was my first time here, but not my last.

Excellent po boy lunch. Try the fried chicken. They serve 6 or 11 inch sandwiches, and a 6 inch could probably feed two, unless you're really hungry.

We heard about this place through some nice folks at a recent visit to Tipitina's, who said it was the place they went when craving a "real po-boy", so we went. We got "the bomb" and it was THE BOMB! Best comfort food we've had in New Orleans! Bread was soft and thin, which I prefer to the thicker toasted French bread you find. Loved the grilled shrimp and catfish. Wonderful hole-in-the-wall place.

Incredible portions... Incredible tastes... Incredible Po Boy concepts! A must stop if you're in the area! Marvin is the man and it was an honor filming at this location...

Returned here after being away 4 years to find Marvin still offering great PoBoys with a smile. His fiancé who took our orders is a sweetie with a smile to match Marvin's. Don't expect a lot of ambiance. Huge lunches and friendly patrons keep this place rockin.

Don't let the outside, or smallish plain inside of this place fool you. The Po-Boys are incredible. Has to be one of the best I've ever eaten. this is a hole in the wall! off the beaten path, but find it! the food was delicious and a lot for the money.

review_list:
Delicious food, margaritas and good beer selection for only having a few taps. Sunday lunch is very busy and because of that, a little slow, but our server was great!

We came here not knowing what to expect, it was just close to our hotel. What an awesome little place! I got the steak nachos and my boyfriend got the enchilada trio.... We both loved it all. The queso and the salsa were fresh and delicious too. We will be back. We even saved our menu as a keepsake.

Needed to eat before our off-Broadway nite at the Saenger theatre -- and have been here before -- good choice and we left satisfied -- both quality and quantity, Almost any dish on the menu is top notch. Service great -- on street parking can be tough tho - so plan for that.

I am a Juan's regular and have visited this location approx 5 times...the margaritas (doubles are $6 at Happy Hour) are amazing as is the queso dip and pork tacos.

The margaritas were really good. The burritos were very good , my was called El Pastor, with mango. Very good. This place was right across the street from from our hotel.

Food was good - best TexMex we have had outside of Texas. We really enjoyed the smart, young, courteous wait staff. Good nachos, though I would have preferred a bit more per serving. Margaritas are good.

This restaurant was right across the street from our hotel. Went there one day for lunch. I had a casadilla and my husband had their Flying Burrito. Very good! And very reasonable prices. Always busy which was a good sign.

Stopped in one day for lunch. Food was great and the place had a really cool vibe to it. Everyone knew we were tourists but they all treated us like locals.

Everything on the menu looked appetizing. Juan's burrito was an excellent choice! The nachos were very filling. I needed a to go box.

Portions were huge, service was quick and friendly. Hubby and son were hungry after site seeing all day but eager to get to the game. They are very happy right now :) Perfect!
title: Juan's Flying Burrito, New Orleans

This place is not to be overlooked. I was looking over the cocktail menu trying to decide, when Mark the bar manager asked me what sort of drinks and flavors I liked. He made something up on the spot that was excellent. I only wish we had come here sooner during our trip!

Wonderful little bar serving great cocktails.

Always end up here when I visit New Orleans. There is only one downside..........if you get a table at the entrance/facing the street.........you will never leave because you people watch, drink, listen to music and your day is over. We love the locals here and always feel at home.

The Chart Room is a great find in the French Quarter. A dive bar at it's best. Very small place but well worth the search!!

We were staying in a vacation condo in the same building, so happy to find a treat for breakfast. The crepes were tasty, big enough to share.

I know - its NOLA and I should be eating gumbo, crawfish and oysters. But I've now been here twice in as many days and if I were staying longer I'd probably come back again. The prosciutto crepe is one of the best things I've ever had - its got truffle butter for Christ's sake.

My husband and I have been here many times when we travel to NOLA. We always have a great time here.

Boondock Saint was a great place to hang out with friends for a few hours. Drinks are reasonably priced and the service was great.

This is one of our favorite local bars. It is off of Bourbon Street!! The Bartenders are friendly and the atmosphere is full of music and alcohol!

Stopped in for a drink - what's so unique about this bar is its being owned by a retired law enforcement officer and the ceiling beams/joists (I'm not a carpenter!) are decorated with patches from police departments all over the country. Was in there early evening and not a lot going on so I don't know if they ever have...

The Boondocks Saint is a good place to have a drink in the French Quarter. We've stopped more than once, often while waiting for the next show at Preservation Hall across the street a bit. I think one of the best things about Boondocks Saint is that you can talk in here without having to scream one the top of...

The food was absolutely perfect. My wife and i really enjoy the evening. Very good place and waitering and we will come back, for sure.

I loved this place. When we went, they were playing the movie, Boondock Saints, on the tv. Love that movie. The beer was pretty cheap considering some of the other places we went. It's a comfy Irish bar. They also had a great musician playing Irish music which was a nice change from the other live music on the street.

Steps away from Bourbon Street, but once you walk in, you feel like you are far away from all the noise. The Boondock Saint is a quaint little Irish pub. They have very friendly bartenders and pour a very good Guinness. I think a few of the local bartenders end up here after their shifts.

Dropped in because we heard that this was a good stop off from Bourbon St if it got too crazy. The bartender was friendly and we met up with some locals that provided quite a few good suggestions on places to go and see. Great local place to relax away from all the crowds. The bartenders are all very friendly. Don't let the motif, mislead you the place is much cleaner in comparison to many other FQ bars.

We had never been to a fondue restaurant before had no idea how it worked but if they are all like this I think we will be junkies going forward. Great service too much food and so much fun interacting with our meal. If you haven't you really should!

review_list:
I stopped in Slice to get a slice to-go. It took at most 10-15 min. I had heard and read about Slice, but had never eaten there. You can get any pizza by the slice. They had daily drink specials.

I was running errands on my lunch break when I saw Slice. I had heard and read a lot about it. I stopped in and got a slice to go. It took almost 10 min. to order and get my slice. They had daily drink specials and you can get any pizza slice. I will be back.

Stopped at this restaurant when everyone was tired and hungry. The atmosphere is casual and inviting. Our waitress was so friendly. We got one pie but each half was different. Our 7 year got pasta and butter ($4). Good wine and beer selection. Would definitely go back!

Right across from Whole Foods on Magazine, this is a fun, friendly place at lunchtime. I particularly like to be able to order a small or large salad with a slice of pizza. Not such a heavy meal but nice booths and service. Children even babies are welcomed.

Stopped for a slice of pizza and drink on Friday mid afternoon while shopping on Magazine street in New Orleans. I had Cajun Delight slice of pizza which was great. I loved the old charm of the restaurant. Located across from the Whole Foods Market. Highly recommend.

Perfect haven for pizza lovers! A variety of toppings coupled with sangria by the pitcher make for a fun night in the city. Depending on seating location, one could entertain themselves by watching the delightful chefs or chatting with the bartenders. Wait staff is always friendly and eager to please.

Great idea to sell pizza by the slice! Slices are large and very tasty. The staff, all very young, seemed to be more interested in standing around talking than working. It took nearly 20 minutes to get a salad starter and they were not busy. We will go back as the food was very good.

We got the bacon, cheese, and roasted garlic with a white type of sauce, with a cold beer. Thin crust. Decently priced. A good stop while shopping on Magazine street.

Glad we stopped here!!! We were looking for a quick meal to fill up and Slice delivered!!! My son said "we are moving here" lol he's very serious about his pepperoni pizza!!
They have a great selection on the menu and daily specials as well. I had the white bean soup and a grilled cheese that was very tasty. My...

Perfect pie, high heat, crispy, etc. sauce is robust without being overpowering. Helpful waiter, just the right amount of attention to detail. Nice wine list, great location, easy in and out, great vibe. Thanks.

Excellent service. Amazing food. Great wine list. This is one of our favorite place in New Orleans. We know that we'll never be disappointed here.

Excellent place to top the night off. Cory & Donny provide delicious suggestions not 2 mention they both R good looking. The atmosphere is upscale w/ energetic music. Great crowd, affordable prices, experienced professional customer service and an array of unique dishes. A must try!

My wife and I went for a date night and really enjoyed the sushi. The only thing that could have made it better is a dance floor in the back... (They crank the music up.)

Great service, nice atmosphere, I was there to celebrate my boyfriend birthday. The service was really good and the food delicious.

First meal in New Orleans, and my first time having crawfish. Can't say enough about the prices, flavor, and efficiency of the line. Customers and staff both helped us figure out what to order and how to eat it. Stands out as my favorite meal in NO.

shrimp po boys was great, the fresh seafood was good. I got several pounds of boiled shrimp, crawfish, and blue crabs. They all was really good, We made a bit of mess in the Hotel room but it was all worth the ride out.

What can I say about this food heavenly scrumptious wbest food in town everything is fresh and taste absolutely divine

I live in San Francisco, but every time I am in New Orleans, I always go there. Best Po Boys shrimps and food to go. Call ahead to make sure they are open.

The food in this little gem is Naturally N'awlins!! Do not end your trip until you've been here. My pick is an oyster poboy but you can't leave without CRAWFISH AND A SNOWBALL!!!

When in New Orleans this is the best spot for seafood!! the wait is long. But it's so worth the wait. the portions of food . they give you . you can feed 2 people of the same plate! The shrimp are huge!!

The piano bar opens at two thirty in the afternoon and gets busy really quickly! Great fun time, have a Hurricane, their invention and specialty drink. Great sing along bar!

What's not to love about Pat O'Brien's? I was here 30 years ago and had fun. I was there in October and had fun again...so did everyone who was in town for my son's wedding. Of course, we had the hurricanes! Very delicious:)

this is where the famous drink started we had a couple of these and some gator bites food was good drinks great staff very frindley

Nice little bar with very friendly bartenders. Good selection of beers. Was there on the day they celebrate the half way to St. Patrick day so it was pretty crazy.

Always trying to find the places locals eat well that tourists don't know about. This is fills the bill. Eat in the inner courtyard if you can a really nice setting. Cured fish appetizer melts in your mouth

although this restraint is hard to find in the backwater on the edge the french quarters the food makes up for the hunt. parking is tight and the streets narrow but the brunch is worth it.

We are used to great restaurants in New Orleans. And Chappy's is one of them! We had the most amazing redfish with crawfish sauce, shrimp bisque, coconut cake. And the service was fabulous! Can't wait to go back!

Visited on St. Patricks day and enjoyed a green beer. The pub was lively and the beer was good (for green beer).

Cheap and awesome after night of fun and frolic on Bourbon street as well as breakfast time. Always sooo good!

this is a great place for a quick snack. I personally love the chili pups which are mini chili dogs. the mini burgers are also a quick grab and walk around snack.

The food was overpriced but ok. The location is very small and not easy to navigate with a stroller. There was a second level but it was not accessible with the stroller so I could not say what was located up there. An error occurred with the order and the cashier argued.

Reasonably priced and very comfortable neighbor restaurant. Super location in Algiers Pt across the street from the ferry.

This small restaurant with a amazing wine cellar selection is in Algiers point.
The menu is very limited really just cheese and pizza.
But the choice of wine which you select from the rack yourself is great.
We went there twice is our week there.

We had the pizza and it was wonderful. One night we picked up some wine and cheese to eat at our B&B. The owners were so friendly and accommodating. the wine is priced right

Eight of us made reservations in advance and started with the cheese and salami plates, followed by three different home made pizzas. As always, staff excellent, as was the food and wine.

this is a small and simple restaurant steps from the Canal street ferry landing in Algiers Point. The small but tasty menu items are meant to be matched with a glass of wine. Sit in the patio and enjoy a relaxing snack and glass of wine.

We ate here our last evening. It is casual but feels intimate at the same time. I highly recommend the Crab Au Gratin appetizer and the pizzas. Our party had two and both were delicious.

Wine and dine at this great little place, food is amazing and so is the wine and the owners.
Make the trip to Algiers Point just to try this place, it's worth it!

I don't know why they get a bad rap, because these dogs are just plain good. Maybe it's because they are sold on some of the dirtiest places in the Quarter, ( ex: Bourbon St & St Ann), but I've eaten many and never got sick.

To be found on every intersection of Bourbon Street, lucky dogs are great for folks either in a rush, or who like to eat and walk. Not the most luxurious of food, but the chili is a wonderful addition rather than just a plain ol' hot dog.

Lucky dogs are an institution in New Orleans but are roadside type dogs. Available with Chili and Cheese. Good late night fare.

The carts are all over. We had eaten fancy for the evening and walked around the Quarter for a while. I wanted a snack.
I thought the chili was very good the hotdog had a good taste. It was mess, so get plenty of napkins. You need to try one.

This place is amazing. It serves only vegan food and drinks. It is such a peaceful place that is filled with great people! The food is great! I highly recommend!! 5 stars!!

This is hands down my favorite part of New Orleans! I have never been to a place with this good of an atmosphere! The place is also a yoga studio so the people here are so peaceful and nice!<3 The food was great (teriyaki tofu wrap) and so was my Archangle Coffee! I am definitely going back before I leave...


More  



Everything on the board looked appetising. I had a hard job choosing one thing to eat. The inside of the cafe is decorated beautifully and there is a tiny shop through one of the doors, next to the toilets. There were yoga classes going on upstairs. When the food came it was excellent. Just a shame that our food didn't...


More  



The environment here is so peaceful and communal. Maybe because there is a yoga studio upstairs but it wasn't your typical sometimey yoga people that you see in some other cities. They seemed pretty serious and brought in the spiritual aspect. That energy seemed to flow throughout the cafe as well. The staff was very helpful and just really nice....


More  



I visited during my trip to New Orleans, to show a non vegan friend the joys of vegan eating. I love it when I find a 100% vegan establishment. Even better if it's delicious. Great food. Good environment. Fair prices.
I'll definitely be back on future trips.

Recently visited New Orleans and found this restaurant to be a little gem on Canal St. Easy parking in the rear of building My favorite was the Teriyaki Tofu Wrap. I had their Good Karma plate of salad with a delicious almond dressing, brown rice, vegetables and soup... More  



We were looking for a veg restaurant in town and found this beautiful one in Canal street. Fodd is awesomely good ad tasty. People are nice and welcoming. I had a Good Karma plate and my partner took the Malaysian Curry Bowl. We drinked 2 shakes, a tropical paradise and Pina Colada. Everything was lovely. Very highly recommended!

We ordered the Tofu wrap and meal of the day. Both were really good. The personal are very friendly and offered us an extra bowl of rice. Very calm setting. Pity we are from out of town, otherwise we would be regulars.

This place is amazing! My friend and I are visiting from Chicago and this is our last day in Nola - we wanted to end our visit with some healthy vegan food and a good yoga session and we found it! Paid for balcony and open bar part of the night upstairs.. Girls walking around with shots are $4/each tho; what the heck?!
To have the balcony for one night during mardi gras season was an awesome experience though, would definitely recommend it

Disappointed in the food service for the fee charged. Fun on the balcony. Many revellers, mostly drinkers.

Really enjoyed booking this place for a private business party. good location, and we thought the food was good too. had no idea it could be rented. check it out. everyone enjoyed their location and services.

Fun for late night dancing to county music. Good beers and bullrides if you dare. Nice break form Jazz and alternative.

We love country music so stopped by this location while visiting New Orleans. It was a ton of fun. My husband rode the bull which was pretty funny. They even gave him a second free ride for being a firefighter. There are a lot of shooter girls all around NOLA but they didn't bother us after politely turning them down.

Great place to go with a group. Ride the bull and have fun! But stay away from the servers who want to give you test tube shooters. Pretty pushy and not appreciated.

Fun bar on bourbon street. Had 3 for 1 drinks until 9 PM. Had an upstairs with a deck that looked over bourbon street which was awesome. Mechanical bull, and if you tip the guy before you go on, he'll go easy on you. Definitely a great place if you're into the party scene.

This became our party spot when we wanted to have a good time, 3-for-1 drink specials and bull riding. The shot girls were excessively aggressive though.

I held an after hours party at Bourbon Cowboy in their upstairs room and balcony for my investment firm's holiday party on December 10th, and it was a huge success. Stopped by with my younger sister during a recent visit to the city. It was super lively and fun, and it was really cool to know that I was standing in the (arguably) oldest continuously-operating gay bar in the country (after it moved to this location from across the street). Popped in here for a snack (slice). Very nice pizza, good topping choices and lovely staff. Liked the little booths for couples too.

This pizza was ridiculously huge and soooooo good. The service was also great, with several of the employees taking care of us and just making conversation. We ordered the PGA pizza, which was cooked perfectly (their sauce is to die for) and piled high with arugula. They're open pretty late too! Definitely worth a stop if you're in the Garden...

Awesome pizza ,great place nice friendly waitresses !! A nice quiet place to enjoy some great tastin pizza !! Definitely will visit again !!

I have had a lot of pizza in my day.. and honestly this is probably my favorite. We highly enjoyed this restaurant! Service was great and food was top notch!!! If you like great pizza you absolutely need to eat here.

My husband and I are pizza snobs, this place ranks up among the best we've had. Great prices, great selection. The crust is light and airy, with a crunch. So many different options it was hard to decide. We'll likely visit here once more before our trip ends.

My wife had read about this hole-in-the-wall place online, so we decided to visit while we were in NOLA. I ordered two slices: a PGA (must have with the honey drizzled on top!) and the Sportsman's Paradise. Both were excellent and I highly recommend them.
Loved everything about this place - the food, the atmosphere, the server. Definitely would recommend...

Nice being able to grab a slice of pizza nearby to take back to the hotel. Good flavor and combination of ingredients.

Very family friendly. We were here in December and they were decorated for Christmas. Even had fake snow blowing. Several good restaurants. Overall just a good place to hang out for a while.

Decorated for Christmas. You can take a photo with Santa, listen to bands, sing Christmas carols. Have dinner outside at one of the restaurants and watch the excitement. Also a fun bowling alley.

We dropped in here for a quick game and some snacks. its a fun place and I was surprised to see my bowling improve after a couple of adult beverages. The snacks were good and the service friendly and quite attractive. We will go back with a group sometime and it will make a fun evening out mid week.

This place has a nice bar and a unique bowling alley. It was high service. They bring you your shoes at to the alley, there are couches instead of hard plastic chairs. You get a server to take your order. The bowling was a little pricey. I would recommend making a reservation to make sure you can get in.

Very cool people at this bar... Check them out... Friendly, with a lot of locals. Watch a sports game,have a drink, hang out with some friends or alone- Someone will talk to you there. We'll definitely stop by every time we are in New Orleans.

I love this place. When I am in New Orleans this is my first stop. Have a Bloody Mary, get your trip off to a good start. 24 hour place with good drinks and lots of interesting people.

travel back in time to your favorite neighborhood grocery store that everyone knows your name and you know everyone there. the best home cooked daily specials for a terrific price.

title: Barcelona Tapas Cafe, New Orleans

review_list:
Thoroughly enjoyed a cappuccino, very friendly service. Nice atmosphere. Has a great neighborhood feel.

Il Posto Cafe is a small neighborhood place located in the Uptown neighborhood. One of the many wonderful things about New Orleans is (what seems to be) erratic zoning. Il Posto is a very quaint small cafe with a fairly limited menu but very good. My friends call this "girly food". Salads, paninis. I really always enjoy the Italian tuna salad with the tomato soup. The soup is vegan (no cream) but dont let the scare you off. I just love it.

Fresh everything! Made to order, generous servings ( and pours on the great wine). Some of the best basil pesto on the sandwiches I've ever had. The Lemon dressing is THE BEST take some home every time! Very quaint, just lovely lunch spot!

the gelato is really good and they have a nice variety of chocolates to choose from. The jam they sell is also very good.

Good service. Excellent Gelato. The atmosphere was a bit subdued; almost as if it didn't matter to them if they were busy or not. It's next to Johnny's Po-boy where the line was out-the-door. There wasn't a soul in the Sweet Palate. They weren't "working it."

While visiting New Orleans my wife and I took a tour of the French Corridor and came across the The Sweet Palate - We stopped in and wow - a variety of different items for your sweet tooth. Stopped by for some Gelato after dinner while visiting New Orleans. Was quite delicious! I personally like the small portions especially after a large meal. Will visit again next time we are in New Orleans.

Found this jewel by accident. The gelato was the best I have had outside of Italy! The butter pecan was beyond good but understand they change flavors so you may not get to try this one. This bar on bourbon offers great music, great staff, and great drinks. We went to this bar daily to enjoy hand grenades and great music. I would recommend this bar to anyone. They have 3 locations on Bourbon St.

My husband and I were looking foward to visting this bar because it took us over 20 years to make this second trip and we were not disappointed. The bar decor fits the nice cool feel of NOLA. The music was fun too.

Nice place no cover. Across the street from hotel, near all the nightlife action. Band took requests through a air tube, kind of cute.

There are five tropical isle locations on Bourbon Street. I think we found three. They are famous for their "hand grenade" drinks, but you HAVE to order a shark attack! It is a fun way to be served a drink and you will love the entertainment. Great people work there!

What a wonderful old building and great place to dine. I tried the crawfish etouffee for the very first time and it was really amazing. Between the great food and great atmosphere, it was a wonderful dining experience. I highly recommend the place.

This is almost a dive bar, but the history saves it. The husband had to try a Gin Ramon Fizzy. We didn't realize there's A LOT of milk in this drink and on a 104 degree day, that was a bit shady. It tasted good though! The bartenders were attentive.

If you find yourself in New Orleans on a Monday, go here and listen to the piano player. Great songs and drinks! Only draw back is that it is very dark - only candles. It adds to the cool feel since this is the oldest bar!

A fellow at our hotel told me about breakfast sandwiches at this little grocery right by where we were staying at the Olivier House Hotel. So glad we found this good and very affordable little place as much is overpriced in the French Quarter. Lunch specials and all your grocery or travel needs are there too.

Husband and I wanted a quick and inexpensive lunch. We got two sandwiches to go from here and then sat in Jackson Square and had a little picnic.

We always feel welcome and appreciated.
I agree with prior reviewers about it being smokey, HOWEVER, they no longer allow smoking in the facility.
What an improvement.
Go to Fahys.

Very friendly and good prices, nice variety of beverages. Ice cold beers. Stopped in after walking the cemetery tour. Great break before heading back to bourbon st.

right across from our hotel, perfect break from Bourbon crazy....made a big deal out of our youngest's 21st for us right after midnight. Thanks ! He was so tickled and will always remeber that night...

Awesome food and open 24/7. It was right around the corner from our hotel Royal St. Charles. Spices were so hot I rubbed my eye and cried lol

A local told us about this place when another restaurant was closed. A real hole in the wall but the food was great. Try the Greek omelet or the club. The service wasn't bad either.

A small restaurant but the charm and appeal is a real true feel of how they do it. Went here on our first morning as the locals had recomended it. So good we went back the next morning
Really nice tasty food and plenty of it. When in New Orleans we will visit again

title: Coco Hut, New Orleans

review_list:
Found the place on accident! We were in for a treat! Since it was all about mufflettas, we decided to share a large one!!! Oh boy, it was a large sandwich! Crispy bread, thick layer of olive spread and combo of Italian meats make one gigantic deliciousness!!! Try it!!!!

Had quick lunch and throughly enjoyed the food. The portion sizes are huge and the sandwiches are really well done. Onion rings and gumbo great as well. Only complaint is price but frankly had I known we could have split things and it been more reasonable. Not a complaint as much as observation. Would definitely go back.

Went back two days in a row for the muffuletta. Will not disappoint with superb bread and olive salad. The roast beef was spot on and rocked. Great gravy and boy was it messy! Finally we got the turkey muffuletta for friends and it was gone in a flash. Great Jazz Fest food. Will try the original location next visit.

Visited here for the first time on a business trip. Very clean restaurant and super friendly staff. The muffuletta and seafood gumbo were absolutely perfect. The muffuletta was swimming in EVOO and the gumbo was full of shrimp and okra based in a perfect Louisianan rue. I highly recommend!

I was shocked. Used to eat here back in the 70's and they were wonderful. I ordered a small mufelleta, fries, small red beans & rice and a drink and it was over $25!!! The whole was huge!! The half was perfect for my husband and I. The deli was very quaint and cute. I wish I had another one.

You gotta try one of the huge sandwiches while in New Orleans. Be sure to split though. Atmosphere is part of the experience.

We weren't sure when we pulled up if this was the place for us, but we were very happy we tried it out. Everything was great, cooked quickly to order and the service was great too. We had a one night stay in New O. before getting on a cruise. Would have gone back several times. Huge selection, great prices and the food was outstanding. Took a little to "figure" out the ordering process but the servers were super accommodating and friendly. Highly recommend this place!

Great shrimp po-boy! Fresh catfish. Best shrimp fried rice I've ever had. Great meal. Huge portions. We couldn't finish our food!

This place serves very good food and gives very generous portions. There are lots of items on the serving stations but you can also order from the kitchen. Never had a bad meal here yet.

We ate here once and had delivery once so far. We had both breakfast and lunch items with a sausage roll as a repeat. Hearty bacon on the yummy sourdough bread sandwiches is perfect. The sweet pig was the best. Totally want more yummy good value places like this. Great experience !

I love this breakfast spot. Although small on the inside, the food is cooked to order with precision and care. What started as a seafood market has transformed itself into the best sandwich shops I've ever eaten at. There's plenty of side choices that start with common fries and...

Craving some Mexican food. Found that this place was fairly close to our location so went for it.
Chips and a very mild salsa greet you as you are seated. Very small but clean little restaurant. Music was a bit loud.
Waitress was great, very attentive.
We were there during happy hour, ordered a couple of the house margaritas, okay,...

I real dive and hole in the wall off the interstate, but delicious. Think we were the only non-native Spanish speakers in the restaraunt. Inexpensive, and very authentic. Futbol on the TV an added bonus, and it appears they have quite the Karoke set up as well. Highly recommended.

review_list:
A small, 3 table restaurant, serves good Chinese food with quick service and reasonable prices.
The menu is extensive. with most clients electing takeout.
Most dishes are served with pork fried rice or white rice included. The egg rolls are great.
Don't expect fancy, just good food at competitive prices.

Hong Kong Kitchen in Harahan, LA, is always fast and efficient. They always have the freshest foods, and the orders are filled quickly. My family likes the Boneless Chicken, and the Sweet and Sour chicken. The fried rice can be customized to your liking.

The food was excellent and well worth the money spent. We ordered Jumbalaya and it tasted awesome. I had never had it before so I was a little nervous as I know that some people use shrimp but they did not and it was perfect.

Thanks to places like this for not going main stream and staying strange, the world is a better place because of it. Oh and the beverages are very good!!

This is an interesting place, good selection of teas and coffee. Seems very much a community hangout. The restaurant where we had dinner didn't serve tea, so we ended up here and really enjoyed both the tea and the ambiance.

Z'ots was an accidental find last time I was in January but enjoyed the ambience and the customers and barristas. It was quirky, friendly and a great place to spend writing post cards. Papa's Pizza is a Great Place when you a craving for pizza. It is near The Quarter House Resort so I visited Papa's whenever I need a pizza fix.

Were huge fans initially when we moved to the beach. But the last couple of orders, they scrimped on ingredients, the crust was limp and greasy and, for $23 a pizza, just diminishing value. Don't know what happened but they have kind of lost it over the past 6-9 monts.

Great little pizzA in New Orleans and good price .
Food was prepared after we ordered it and the calzone was great......a must try! Very fresh
Owner was super-nice and very friendly. Great location close from everything.
Time seems had stop there!

Four star especially for the price.
Enough choice and very cheap price.
A convenient place for eat quite quickly in New Orleans.

The pizza was very good and prepared quickly. Service was very friendly and the price is right. It is a cash only joint though but the ATM has only a 99 cent transaction fee. That's worth buying a pizza right there. We will be back!

I'm not a fan of pizza .... but it seems that because of Papa's Pizza I changed my mind .... just arrived to the hotel after a long long flight to Orleans tired and hungry... my son suggested to have pizza but I ....didn't like the idea ..anyway he got the best pizza I ever tasted ... the crust is...

We were directed to this little pizza stop by a local. Lady working there was very nice and had our pizza ready quick. It was decent and hit the spot for what we were looking for! Thank you Damon wright for the referral ❤

Was hungry for a pizza and I found this store run by a man from Jordan. I had a very nice conversation with him while the pizza was cooking. I took the pizza out and when I sat down to eat it, I was pleased with the taste. The pizza was good.

By by judgement was no more than average. good service and good pizza but nothing to write home about!

This little restaurant is across the side street from the Canal Street Marriott and is a great TINY place to pop out and grab a pizza or calzones for your room. There is almost always a line but it moves quickly.

This place is perfectly decent Mexican food, cheap and consistent. They also have a small bar attached.

This place has the best quesadilla's, made fresh in front of you with a generous amount of real cheese. You add what you want and leave off what you don't..... Perfection! Taco's... Same thing great taste and quick service yet handmade. You can't go wrong!

We were there over Easter weekend and just kept finding ourselves at Felipes. The price of the food was very good, and the food was great.

Great neighborhood place to get Mexican food. AND it has a bar. The food is great and affordable!! I had the taco salad and really enjoyed it!
